dataprovider.box module¶

3D Box class.

Box – two vectors, forming a box

Modified the code from https://wiki.python.org/moin/PointsAndRectangles

Kisuk Lee <kisuklee@mit.edu>, 2015-2016

class dataprovider.box.Box(v1_or_box, v2=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

A 3D box identified by two vectors.

set_coords – reset box coordinates contains – is a point inside? overlaps – does a box overlap? intersect – intersection between two boxes, if exist merge – merge two boxes min – get min corner point vector max – get max corner point vector expand_by – in-place grow (or shrink) expanded_by – grow (or shrink)

contains(v)[source]¶

Return true if a point is inside the box.

expand_by(v)[source]¶

In-place expansion by v.

expanded_by(v)[source]¶

Return a box with extended borders.

intersect(other)[source]¶

Return intersection between this and other box, if overlaps.

max()[source]¶

Return the max corner as a vector.

merge(other)[source]¶

Return merge of this and other box. Two boxes need not overlap.

min()[source]¶

Return the min corner as a vector.

overlaps(other)[source]¶

Return true if a box overlaps this box.

set_coords(v1, v2)[source]¶

Reset the box coordinates.

size()[source]¶
translate(v)[source]¶
dataprovider.box.centered_box(c, s)[source]¶

Return a box of size s centered on c.

dataprovider.dataset module¶

Dataset classes.

Kisuk Lee <kisuklee@mit.edu>, 2016

class dataprovider.dataset.Dataset[source]¶

Bases: object

Dataset interface.

next_sample()[source]¶
random_sample()[source]¶
class dataprovider.dataset.VolumeDataset(config, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: dataprovider.dataset.Dataset

Dataset for volumetric data.

Attributes:
_data: Dictionary mapping layer’s name to TensorData, which contains
4D volumetric data (e.g. EM image stacks, label stacks, etc.).

_label: List of label layer’s name.

_spec: Net specification. Dictionary mapping layer’s name to its input
dimension (either 3-tuple or 4-tuple).
_range: Range of valid coordinates for accessing data given a net spec.
It depends both on data and net specs.

params: Dataset-specific parameters.

build_from_config(config)[source]¶

Build dataset from a ConfiParser object generated by Parser’s parse_dataset method.

get_imgs()[source]¶
get_range()[source]¶

Return valid range.

get_sample(pos)[source]¶

Extract a sample centered on pos.

Every data in the sample is guaranteed to be center-aligned.

Args:
pos: Center coordinate of the sample.
Returns:

sample: Dictionary mapping input layer’s name to data. transform: Dictionary mapping label layer’s name to the type of

label transformation specified by user.
get_spec()[source]¶

Return dataset spec.

next_sample(spec=None)[source]¶

Fetch next sample in a sample sequence.

num_sample()[source]¶

Return number of samples in valid range.

random_sample(spec=None)[source]¶

Fetch sample randomly

set_spec(spec)[source]¶

Set spec and update valid range.

dataprovider.tensor module¶

Read-only/writable TensorData classes.

Kisuk Lee <kisuklee@mit.edu>, 2015-2016

class dataprovider.tensor.TensorData(data, fov=(0, 0, 0), offset=(0, 0, 0))[source]¶

Bases: object

Read-only tensor data.

The 1st dimension is regarded as parallel channels, and arbitrary access along this dimension is not allowed. Threfore, every data access should be made through 3D vector, not 4D.

Attributes:
_data: numpy 4D array (channel,z,y,x) _dim: Dimension of each channel _offset: Coordinate offset from the origin _bb: Bounding box _fov: Patch size _rg: Range (update dep.: dim, offset, fov)
bounding_box()[source]¶
dim()[source]¶

Return channel shape (z,y,x).

fov()[source]¶
get_data()[source]¶
get_patch(pos)[source]¶

Extract a patch of size _fov centered on pos.

offset()[source]¶
range()[source]¶
set_fov(fov)[source]¶

Set a nonnegative field of view (FoV), i.e., patch size.

shape()[source]¶

Return data shape (c,z,y,x).

dataprovider.transform module¶

Functions for data transformation.

Kisuk Lee <kisuklee@mit.edu>, 2016

class dataprovider.transform.SampleFunction[source]¶

Bases: object

Apply 3D volume function to every volume in a data sample.

class dataprovider.transform.TensorFunction[source]¶

Bases: object

Apply 3D volume function to each channel of 4D tensor.

evaluate(data, spec)[source]¶

Evaluate tensor function specified by spec on data.

dataprovider.transform.affinitize(img, dst=(1, 1, 1), dtype='float32')[source]¶

Transform segmentation to 3D affinity graph.

Args:
img: 3D indexed image, with each index corresponding to each segment.
Returns:
ret: 3D affinity graph (4D tensor), 3 channels for z, y, x direction.
dataprovider.transform.affinitize_mask(msk, dst=(1, 1, 1), dtype='float32')[source]¶

Transform binary mask to affinity mask.

Args:
msk: 3D binary mask.
Returns:
ret: 3D affinity mask (4D tensor), 3 channels for z, y, x direction.
dataprovider.transform.binarize(img, dtype='float32')[source]¶

Binarize image.

Normally used to turn a ground truth segmentation into a ground truth boundary map, binary representation for each voxel being neuronal boundary or not.

Args:
img: 3D indexed image, with each index corresponding to each segment.
Returns:
ret: Binarized image.
dataprovider.transform.binary_class(img, dtype='float32')[source]¶

TODO(kisuk): Documentation.

dataprovider.transform.divideby(img, val=255.0, dtype='float32')[source]¶

Rescale.

dataprovider.transform.flip(data, rule)[source]¶

Flip data according to a specified rule.

Args:

data: 3D numpy array to be transformed. rule: Transform rule, specified as a Boolean array.

[z reflection,
y reflection, x reflection, xy transpose]
Returns:
data: Transformed data.

dataprovider.utils module¶

Utility functions.

Kisuk Lee <kisuklee@mit.edu>, 2016

dataprovider.utils.check_tensor(data)[source]¶

Ensure that data is numpy 4D array.

dataprovider.utils.check_volume(data)[source]¶

Ensure that data is numpy 3D array.

dataprovider.utils.fill_data(shape, filler={'type': 'zero'}, dtype='float32')[source]¶

Return numpy array of shape, filled with specified values.

Args:

shape: Array shape. filler: {‘type’:’zero’} (default)

{‘type’:’one’} {‘type’:’constant’, ‘value’:%f} {‘type’:’gaussian’, ‘loc’:%f, ‘scale’:%f} {‘type’:’uniform’, ‘low’:%f, ‘high’:%f} {‘type’:’randi’, ‘low’:%d, ‘high’:%d}
Returs:
data: Numpy array of shape, filled with specified values.

dataprovider.vector module¶

3D Vector class.

Modified from the vec3d class on the pygame wiki site. http://pygame.org/wiki/3DVectorClass

Kisuk Lee <kisuklee@mit.edu>, 2015-2016

class dataprovider.vector.Vec3d(x_or_triple, y=None, z=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

3d vector class, supports vector and scalar operators, and also provides a bunch of high level functions. reproduced from the vec2d class on the pygame wiki site.
